assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: FALCON v. DNANexus 1.9.0; FALCON-Unzip v. DNANexus 1.0.6; purge_dups v. 51544-08-31; scaff10x v. 4.1.0; Bionano Solve DLS v. 3.2.1; Salsa HiC v. 2.2; Arrow smrtanalysis Pacbio polishing v. 6.0.0.47841; longranger align v. 2.2.2; freebayes Illumina polishing v. 1.3.1; gEVAL manual curation v. 2019-10-16; VGP assembly pipeline individual v. 1.6

bioprojects.title: Pterocles gutturalis (Yellow-throated sandgrouse) genome, bPteGut1, primary haplotype

attributes.name: biomaterial_provider
attributes.value: Sharjah Breeding Centre, United Arab Emirates

biosample.biomaterialProvider: Sharjah Breeding Centre, United Arab Emirates

description.comment: The Yellow-throated Sandgrouse (Pterocles gutturalis saturatior) is a member of the Pteroclididae family (ground dwelling birds restricted to treeless, open country) and can be found in many countries in southern and eastern Africa. They are considered fast and tenacious fliers. This sample was collected from a male at the Sharjah Breeding Center in the United Arab Emirates tended by An Pas, of a wild caught animal in Tanzania, and procured by Tom Gilbert (same individual as SAMN02339892 for the 2014 Avian Phylogenomics Project), and used to generate a chromosome level reference assembly as part of the G10K-VGP and B10K Projects.
description.title: Animal sample from Pterocles gutturalis

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: Yellow-throated sandgrouse sample for G10K-VGP reference genome

assemblyInfo.comments: This assembly represents the principal haplotype of the diploid genome Pterocles gutturalis and includes the chromosomes. The alternate haplotype sequences are in WGS project WNNF00000000
assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel I CLR; Illumina NovaSeq; Arima Genomics Hi-C; Bionano Genomics DLS
